newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian police confiscate 270 kg of explosives.
newsitem.headline: Italian police confiscate 270 kg of explosives.

text.p: Italian police said on Saturday they had smashed an extortion ring, detaining nine people and confiscating 270 kg (600 lb) of explosives.
Police said they found the explosives in two separate raids near southeastern Adriatic port of Brindisi.

The operation began two weeks ago when police discovered 70 kg (150 lb) of explosives in a cave, police said, and concluded late on Friday when another 200 kg were confiscated after a raid on a warehouse.
Police said the explosives were set to be packaged into small bombs for use in an extortion racket.
The nine suspects were being held on charges of criminal association and illegal transport and sale of explosives.
